nav.div: Roselle Park School District » Covid-19 Information

a.title: NJTV Announcement
a.style: letter-spacing: 0.3px; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-line: none; color: rgb(29, 29, 29);

span.a:
Starting Monday, April 6, children throughout New Jersey will be able to tune into NJTV,
New Jersey’s public television network, for NJTV Learning Live, a program featuring lessons taught by
New Jersey teachers.
Each weekday, NJTV Learning Live will offer four programs for grades 3 to 6.

Third-grade instruction
begins at 9 a.m.; fourth-grade programming is at 10 a.m.; fifth grade is 11 a.m.; and sixth-grade
instruction begins at noon. Subjects will include English language arts, math, science, social studies, and
a “special” such as art, music or physical education.
Comcast in NJ – channel 23; High Def 261 and 800
Verizon Fios – channel 23; High Def 523
Dish Network New York – channel 58; High Def 8113
DirecTV New York – channel 50

a.title: Free and Reduced Meal Information While Schools Are Closed

span.a: Free and Reduced Meal Information while Schools are Closed

span.strong: Please be reminded that we will continue to feed our families that are eligible for free and reduced breakfasts and lunches. These families may pick up their breakfasts and lunches as follows:

p.span:
Location: Outside High School Cafeteria on Lincoln Ave
Time: 11:00am- 1:00pm

span.style: letter-spacing: 0.3px; background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245); font-family: latobold; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

a.title: Please click here to read an updated message from the Union County Health Department with information regarding the Coronavirus

span.a: Please click here to read an updated (3/2/2020) message from the NJ Department of Health with information regarding the Coronavirus
tudents or parents that need technology assistance should email techhelp@rpsd.org
